111322.content:
I stretched, opening my eyes to a well-tanned girl with bright red hair.

"Morning Sleepyhead!" she said in a cheery voice.

"Din!" I yelped, nearly jumping out of my sleeping bag, opening my blue eyes. "Don`t do that!"

"Why not?" she asked, giggling at my reaction as she ruffled by brown hair.

"Because you know I hate that!" I responded fixing my hair back to it`s spiky style.

"Well, it`s almost lunchtime, and you still need to practice your act," Din replied, getting up and scolding me a bit. "Magic won`t improve without practice you know."

"I know, I know..." I said, sitting up.

"C`mon, Impa`s got stew today!" Din said, running out of my pup tent in her usual manner.

"Alright, alright," I said, standing up and getting dressed. I put on my brown boots and tan pants as well as a white shirt with silver trim. I slung my dark blue cloak over my shoulders and pinned it together.

"You ready already?" Din asked.

"Yes Din, I`m on my way out!" I said, grabbing my brown gloves and my twin bracelets I bought from a market a while back. They were supposed to enhance magical power but all they really did was look cool and more magical. The old lady I bought them from said they were meant for me, but I didn`t believe her.

---

After lunch, I were trying to meditate, but the nightmares I`d been having lately kept me from focusing.

All I could remember was a large black dragon, Din being blown away, and four lights speaking to me about a coming time or something, followed by a green triangle.

I wondered what it meant just as Din ran back from her walk.

"Someone help! There`s a man collapsed in the nearby clearing!" Din yelled, snapping me out of my trance.

"Damn, we gotta help him!" I said, standing up and running to the clearing Din led me to. We found a young man with pointed ears and wearing a green hat and tunic.

"Green clothes and hat..." I said to myself before Din snapped me back to reality.

"C`mon, don`t just stand there, help!" Din said, pushing me.

"Alright already!' I said, picking him up as others came to help us.
111322.title: Zicael

1113221.content:
A little while later, I was meditating beside our visitor cause Din wanted someone to watch him, and I can`t say no to her. Mostly cause she doesn`t let me.

"Urgh..." I heard him say as I turned, seeing him come to.

"Glad to see you`re up," I said. "I`m Zicael, a magician in this troupe of ours."

"I`m Link," the blonde-haired guy said as he looked at me. "Where am I?"

"You`re in Holodrum," I replied. "Din found you outside our campsite near a clearing. You were out cold."

"Who`s Din?" Link asked.

"She`s a dancer and my best friend," I replied. "C`mon, I`ll show you around."

"Alright," Link said, standing up and following me as I led him around, introducing him to the others.

Link`s face went wide as I brought him to Impa, the cook.

"And this is Impa, our cook. She joined rather recently since we needed a cook," I said as Impa nodded.

Link and Impa whispered something to each other, and that made me suspicious. We continued on and finally made our way to where Din was dancing.

"Who`s that?" Link asked, obviously blushing.

"That would be Din," I replied. "Hey Din, the guy you found is awake!" I yelled to her, gaining her attention and causing her to jump off the stump she was dancing on.

"You`re up!" Din said to Link smiling. "Welcome to Holodrum! I`m Din, the dancer! Would you like to dance with me?"

"Uh..." Link said hesitantly as Din grabbed his hand. I only laughed and smiled.

"Don`t worry, she does that to everyone she meets!" I yelled back, smiling as Link tried to dance with Din, doing a pretty bad job at it.

I laughed as the music played until I saw a sudden storm cloud roll in. "THUNDERSTORM!" I yelled just before a wind kicked up.

"I`ve found you Din!" a voice boomed over the crashing thunder. "You can`t deceive me by disguising yourself as a dancer."

"What do you mean?" I yelled to the voice from nowhere. "Who are you?!"

A large image of a man in gold armor with a strange black symbol on his chest appeared in the sky, but only as an image.

Din looked shocked and Impa looked rather angered as she got in front of Din. The rest of the troupe members surrounded Din and drew swords, which surprised me.

"Where did those weapons come from?!" I asked, looking at the rest of the troupe.

"I am Onox, General of Darkness!" the image roared. "Now reveal yourself, Oracle of Seasons!"

A large whirlwind began descending from the sky, and my nightmare made sense, the dragon, the tornado, and the green triangle.

"NO DIN!" I yelled, jumping for her as the whirlwind descended upon her, blowing Impa and the other troupe members away.

"Link! Zicael! Help me!" Din yelled as she was sucked into the whirlwind.

Link jumped for Din and I struggled to run towards her, but we were both blown away and knocked out.

---

All across Holodrum, there was a strange occurrence. With Din imprisoned by Onox, the seasons in Holodrum fell in chaos. It began cycling from one season to the next at a random and rapid pace. Crops died, water froze, and the land slowly began to die. If this continued, life in Holodrum would cease to exist.
1113221.title: Later that day...

11132212.content:
"DIN!" I yelled, sitting up at a rapid pace. I quickly looked around and saw snow covering the land, which was really odd, and Link and Impa beside me.

"Zicael, you`re up," Impa said, looking at me and kneeling down. "Careful, you were injured."

"I don`t care, where`s Din?" I asked.

"She was taken by General Onox," Impa replied. "I failed Princess Zelda..."

"Wait, Princess Zelda? Does this have to do with all the other troupe members having swords?" I asked.

"Yes, it does," Impa replied. "The truth is, I was assigned to bring Din to Hyrule for her safety. The other troupe members were all Hylian Knights to help guard us."

"And was I the only one who didn`t know about this?!" I yelled, now furious that I was lied to. "Why the hell didn`t you tell me?!"

"Din asked us not to," Impa said, causing me to calm down. "She didn`t want to worry you about her being the Oracle of Seasons and the responsibility she bore as such."

"Ow... my aching head..." Link said, coming to.

"Link, are you alright?" Impa asked, attending to Link.

"Yeah, just a little banged up," Link replied. "What happened?"

"That which Zelda foresaw has come to pass," Impa replied. "Holodrum has come to an hour of tribulation! Link, I know we ask much of you, but please, there is no one else we can turn to! Rescue Din and return peace to Holodrum!"

"And what am I? Chopped Moblin?" I asked, gaining Impa and Link`s attention. "Din is my best friend and we`ve known each other since we were kids! Oracle or not, I`m going with you to rescue her!"

"But I`ve seen you fight and your skill compared to Link`s is pitiful..." Impa said, her words jabbing me.

"But I also have traveled all over Holodrum with Din and I know the land better than anyone, especially Link!" I replied.

"He`s got a point Impa," Link replied. "I don`t know my way around Holodrum, and a guide would be helpful."

"It`s true," Impa said. "And I would help, but I was injured during the storm and I need to rest. And time is of the essence, so Zicael, please help Link rescue Din."

"Like you had to ask," I said, cracking my knuckles. "So where do we begin?"

"Tell what has happened to the Maku Tree in Horon Villlage," Impa replied. "He is the guardian of all Holodrum. Surely he can help."

"Understood," Link said. "Zicael, lead the way."

"Will do," I replied. "Horon Village is just south of here."

And with that, our journey began.

1113221211.content:
"Oh, we should stop here before we leave town!" I said as we neared a building with a sign on the front with a ring in it.

"Why?" Link asked, looking at the small shop.

"Well, for one, we could use the help," I said, walking in. Link quickly followed.

Before the two of us stood a man in a turban with a thin, curled mustache.

"Welcome to Vasu`s Jewelers!" the man said. "I am Vasu!"

"Hey Vasu," I said, waving. "I`d like to exchange rings."

"Oh, welcome back Zicael!" Vasu replied getting out a small ring that had a fist-shaped jewel on it as I pulled out a ring box from my pocket. "Who is your friend?"

"This is Link," I replied, trading the fist-shaped ring for one with a small red rupee-like gem on it. "He`s a visitor from Hyrule and I thought it`d be a good idea to stop here before we continue our journey."

"You still haven`t explained why you brought me here," Link commented.

"Well, some of the rings of Holodrum are special," I replied, looking at Link. "See the ring I`m wearing now?"

"Yes," Link replied, looking at the fist-shaped gem.

"That is a Fist Ring," Vasu explained. "It makes your bare hands as strong as a sword slash when you wear it!"

"Wow, really?" Link asked. "What other rings are there?"

"Well, let me use Zicael`s other ring as an example," Vasu said, pulling out a large ring box and opening it, showing the red rupee-like gem. "This is a Red Joy Ring, and it lets you have more luck in finding Rupees!"

"Cool," Link replied. "So how do I find rings?"

"You can find rings in Gasha trees, in shops, or in dungeons," I replied. "But only someone like Vasu can identify what kind of ring they are."

"That`s right!" Vasu said. "And since this is your first time coming here, I shall give you a gift!" Vasu then pulled out a small ringbox and opened it, showing a small ring with a musical note engraved on it. It seemed colorless and made of pewter.

"Well, what kind of ring is it?" Link asked.

"Well, let me appraise it and find out!" Vasu said, smiling as he pulled out a gold-edged dustcloth. He quickly began scrubbing the ring and looked at it closely. His own rings seemed to shine as the ring he was appraising began to change color and glow a bit. "It`s a friendship ring! It signifies the beginning of a friendship."

"Cool," Link said. "So if I find any other rings, I should bring them back here, right?"

"Yes!" Vasu said. "And for a small fee of 20 Rupees, I shall appraise them!"

"So that`s the catch," Link said, looking a bit glum.

"Yeah, he always appraises the first one for free," I said, smiling. "But now that you have a ring box, we can continue."

"Alright, thanks again Vasu," Link said as we walked towards the door.

"Remember, rings do nothing unless worn!" Vasu said as Link and I left.

It was a beautiful day in the Kokiri forest. Link was in his house when Saria came up. "Hey Link, what are you doing? If it's not important, would you want to go for a walk with me?" "Uh, yeah it's not important. Where are we walking?" Link asked. Link had always had a crush on Saria (and Zelda) and he thought this might be his chance to ask her on a date. "Let's walk trough the woods. I'll race you!" and Saria darted off toward the woods. Link quickly caught up and passed due to all the running he did across Hyrule field when he was saving it from Ganondorf.

Link and Saria arrived at the entrance to the woods and slowed to a walk. They began talking of their past and old memories when suddenly, they heard a noise in the bushes. Link hid Saria behind him and drew his sword. He checked every bush then a Wolfos appeared from behind him, but there was something different about this Wolfos. Not only was it much bigger than any other one Link had seen, but it had a second head and was standing on two feet. "I may need a better sword." Link said and he was right. His Kokiri Sword was like a very small knife compared to this beast.

Link fought the monster as well as her could, but he could not beat it. Link was exhausted and was on the ground when another boy jumped out from the bushes and slashed at the Wolfos. His sword was much larger than the Kokiri sword but was still small and light enough to be held in one hand. Link and Saria got a good look at him at this moment with the wolf running off, badly injured. He was maybe a year or two older than Link but had the same hair and was also left - handed. He was about average height for his age with brown pants and a green, short sleeved shirt. He was muscular and handsome and Saria was in shock at his strength and courage. She was instantly in love.

The boy did not see because Link had hidden her behind a bush. He walked up to Link and helped him up. "Thanks," Link said still in some pain for the attacks the Wolfos had landed on him. "Hey, I've never seen you before, especially in these woods, and believe me, I know these woods well." "I'm Kiron. I'm from Hyrule Castle. I'm Zelda's brother. You must be Link. Zelda told me a lot about you, but to be honest, I expected you to be better with a sword." Kiron replied with a bow. "Wait a second, Zelda doesn't have a brother. And even if she did, I would have seen you when I was in the castle before." Link countered in disbelief. "Well that depends on what parts you've been in." "Well I was in Zelda's room, the throne room and the entire east wing." "Well then that's why. My room's in the west wing. and most of the time I'm in the fields or Lake Hylia practicing with my sword." "Right. Well then, prove it. Take us to the castle and if you get in without any trouble from the guards and Zelda backs up the fact that you're her brother, then I'll believe it" Link said.

Saria, still hiding in the bush, heard this and bursted out. "Yeah, lets go to the castle!" Saria exclaimed "Wait, who are you?" Kiron asked " And how long have you been there?" "This is Saria. She's my friend, and apparently, wants to go to the castle." Link said a little startled since during the fight, he forgot he hid her in a bush. "Yes, please." Saria said, still staring at Kiron lovingly. "OK. Let's go."
1313.title: The Start of a New Adventure

13131.content:
They quickly arrived at the castle and and approached the gate. "I bet I'll need to use the extra ten rupees that I brought to get us in." Link whispered to Saria. "Give him a chance, Link. You have no proof that he's lying." Saria countered. They arrived at the front gate and when the guard caught sight of Kiron, his eyes widened. "Prince Kiron," Link's jaw dropped when the guard said this, "What are you doing outside of the castle? You know your father doesn't like you sneaking out." the guard seemed angry but kept the necessary amount of respect in his voice to prevent him from loosing his job. "I know, but it can be so boring sometimes being on castle grounds all day." "Tell me about it." The guard muttered under his breath. Kiron either didn't hear it or ignored it. "I've brought some friends with me. May I bring them in?" Kiron asked though he really didn't have to. "Of course, but your friend in the hat has to remove his weapons." "Actually, he's going to fence with me and teach me some sword techniques." Kiron said, though it sounded like it was intended to be a command. "Very well, but I'll be watching him." the guard said, this time the anger in his voice more obvious.

They walked past the rest of the guards with little or no conversation. They arrived in the center of the castle and Kiron asked "Where do you want to go?" Link was the first to respond, "Well first I want to let Zelda know I'm here and secondly, I want to apologize for not believing you." "Apology accepted. You know where Zelda's room is right?" "Yeah, I know. Just let me know where you will be so I can find you later." Link knew that he probably wouldn't because he hadn't talked to Zelda in a while and he had a lot to talk about. "We'll be in my room, west wing, third door on the right." "OK, bye. Oh, Saria, don't forget we have to leave at sundown or we will miss the Deku Tree Sprout's birthday." Link said "Don't worry, I won't forget." Saria said. They split up and each went opposite ways through the many halls of
Hyrule Castle.

"I have had a dream similar to that. In mine, Hyrule is in ruins and where this castle now stands, there is a dark, scary-looking palace. I hated to be rude, but something was happening up there. "Hey Midna" I spoke up, "Are you alright?" I heard a sniff and clearing her throat. "Yeah, I'm fine" she said. "Just keep moving." I didn't bother to look up. She was right, I needed to find these bugs and fast. Link was waiting at the spring. I ran as fast as I possibly could. I kind of liked being a wolf like Link. Although, I kinda missed being a smaller creature. I charged through the town with great speed. But, I suddenly stopped. Midna almost flied off but managed to hold on. "What was that all about?!" she exclaimed.

I ignored her. There was a scent in the air that seemed too familiar. I looked around the building for the source of the scent. It seemed to be coming from inside the building. There were a few posts sticking out from the walls that lead to the roof. I tried to jump but I didn't jump high enough. Midna pulled on one of my ears, "You idiot! You'll never get up there alone! You need my help!"

Midna was annoying but she made a point. I believe this is what she was telling me before. I probably should pay attention to some speeches. They may be long and annoying but some might actually be useful. She directed me to one point of the building and lept off my back. She appeared on the first post out from the building. I jumped and surprisingly I made it. She appeared on the next, and I repeated the process. The roof was boarded up but I needed to find a way in. "Why are we even up here?" she asked. "You'll never find the bugs like this." Before I could even reply, the boarding collapsed under us. I landed with a thud but Midna slowly drifted down. "Now I need to learn to change forms every once in a while" I muttered before struggling to stand. Midna jumped on my back, but my legs were still too weak and I fell to the floor once again. "Get up you lazy slave!" she shouted. I growled back at her but struggled.

(Midna's thoughts)
I'm doing great...he suspects nothing. But, I think I'm treating him a little to harshly. I mean, he's struggling to stand up now. No, I don't care about him remember. I need to keep treating him this way, no matter how much it hurts him or me.

(Back to Tolray)
I looked around at the room. Several spirits collected around what looked like an old couch and the one hovered by the window. I needed to use my senses, but I had no idea how to. "Well, might as well try..." I said to myself. I closed my eyes and tried my best to focus. I didn' open my eyes, but I began to hear something. It sounded like crying. I opened my eyes, being able to see clearly now. All of the village children were there; Malo, Talo, Beth, even Colin. But, Illia was not even there. Link is going to be depressed when he sees this. They all gathered around this one man and another girl. I turned towards the window and saw a man. He looked old and was wearing a blacksmithing mask. But by the looks of him, he didn't seem like one.

"Darn it, I can't see any of those dang black creatures anywhere" he said. "It's only a matter of time before they finally get in here."

His talking seemed to upset Beth. The man turned to her, "Don't worry child, we will be safe in here."

"Yeah, I wonder how long you'll be saying that until those monsters break in" continued the man. "Don't you remember that women across town? She had her house barricaded, and she was taken along with the others! It's only a matter of time before they break into here. And once they get in here, they will stop at nothing until they all..."

"BARNES!"

The man, most likely Barnes, became instantly quiet. Beth broke down into heavy sobs in the man's lap. The man sighed and looked towards Barnes. Barnes chuckled and lowered his mask. He was lucky I couldn't hurt him now, otherwise I would bite his sorry...

"Don't worry Beth" said a voice. I turned to see Colin trying to talk to her. Colin was always a sweet kid. Short with blonde hair, but he always took everyone's insults and remarks. "Everything will be alright Beth. Link and Tolray will be here!" The room became quiet as everyone looked at Colin. "I don't know why, but I feel like they're right here. I can feel it."

"Aww....they still have faith in you" said Midna sarcastically. I growled at her but stopped when I saw Barnes on the ground. "Listen Renado, you know as well as I do that we're out in the open here. Isn't there another room or something to hide in?" Renado glanced over at Barnes and went back to Beth, "There is a cellar...."

Barnes jumped up from his lying down position and scuttled over to him, "You had a cellar all this time and never said ANYTHING?! WHERE'S THE ENTRANCE MAN?!"

"The entrance can only be opened when all of the torches in the room are lit."

Barnes grabbed a stick and lit it with the fire around. He began to walk towards the first torch. "I wouldn't do that" said the girl. "When my father told me to close the cellar, he said that there were these bugs like the creatures outside." Barnes threw down the stick and stomped his foot on the flame. I smiled and turned off my senses. I walked over towards the stick. But before I grabbed it, I looked up at Midna, "Now was it a bad thing that we came out here?" Midna pouted and then I grabbed the stick with my mouth. I lit one side of it and ran up the stairs. With a few simple jumps, all of the flames were lit. The center statue that looked like an owl began to move. A small door appeared beneath it. I ran over and jumped down the opening. The landing wasn't as rough, but it hurt. The extra weight on my back wasn't helping either. I heard a soft singing noise. I changed my senses and saw both bugs. With a simple bite, I collected two tears. With Midna's helps I managed to get back out. But I had to burst through a wooden door though. With a few shakes, all of the splints were off. I searched through the lower buildings, but only managed to find a few more tears. All of them were hiding somewhere. I noticed a cliff and a small shack. I quickly ran up the cliff. But, it was taller than expected and there was no path up there. I glanced back at Midna, "You wouldn't happen to be able to teleport us to that cliff?" Midna yawned and pretended to be asleep. I rolled my eyes but advanced. "Alright, but just listen, if you fall off, I'm not catching you."
I jumped from building to building and lept higher and higher. I would make it up there in no time. I even felt lighter. Wait...lighter.

I shifted into my bat form and grabbed Midna's arm. I haven't stayed as a bat for a while, so some things were slightly new. Midna looked up at me in shock. "I know I said I wouldn't catch you" I said before she could say anything, "But I'm not like that."

(Midna's thoughts)
He....he saved me. After all the crap I put him through, he saved me. Wait...what am I so surprised about....I could have managed myself. After all I can float. But still, this human is very....interesting...

(Back to Tolray)
Once we were on the ledge I collapsed onto the ground. I never really took the time to notice that Minda was much larger than me in my bat form. After a minute rest, I shufted back into a wolf and she jumped on me. I dug my into the shack and listened carefully. I heard two more, but they were in the fireplace. There was no way I could get them out of there, but I then saw a stick with a flame. I threw the stick into the pile of wood and it lit the fireplace. The bugs flew out, but they were on fire. They slammed against the walls, and the walls caught on fire. A few small explosions occured and I cowared from them. "Sorry Tolray, but I'm out of here!" She flew off my back and down the hole I dug up. I shitfted into my snake form and slithered out. Unfortunately, a large piece of rubble fell and slammed against my body. I tried to move, but I couldn't. "Midna help!" I shouted. I saw nothing but flames surround me. The hole was possibly too dangerous to go back. Midna was obviously going to find Link to finish her job. I closed my eyes and prepared for my death.

Suddenly, I felt something wrap around me and drag me out. My eyes were still closed from the amount of smoke, but I heard a massive explosion. I managed to open my eyes and look up. Midna had me in her hand...er...hair. She saw me look at her and dropped me. I slithered up to her, but she pushed me away. "I don't want to talk about it. Just change back into a wolf and lets get going." I ignored her and circled around her. "Midna...you...you saved me" I said. "Why would you save me...?"

1511211122111211111111.content:
(Midna's thoughts)
....Why did I save him...? Every cell in my body said no but my mind said yes. Do I....do I like him...? NO! Don't even attempt to think that! I...I hate...no...I...I don't know anymore...

(Back to Tolray)
"I only need you to collect the remaining Fused Shadows" she said. I slithered around her to check her face. Her expression was straight, she wasn't lying. That kinda hurt. She saved me just to do her bidding. "But...Link can do it too..." I mentioned. Midna waved her hand, "Link would never do it if I let you die. You being alive just means I still have his trust now." I was saddened even further but I guess she was right. Those Fused Shadows do cause a problem. I shifted back into a wolf and collected the two Tears of Light. I walked back over to Midna, and she jumped on my back harshly. The pain hurt, but it didn't hurt as much in my heart. I didn't know why I was feeling like this either. Midna kicked her leg beside me just like a horse, "Come on! Get going!"

I growled slightly but ran back down to the ground. I couldn't feel no bugs in the town, so I should check the other areas. I walked to the deepest part of the village to where the path split off. The one path was blocked off but the other path wasn't. It lead up towards a towering mountain that looked menacing. I looked at the sign between the paths. I swallowed and sense of courage I had when I read the name, "Death Mountain." I was hesitant, but Midna kicked my sides once more. I ran up the path, jumped up the side stones and landed on the top of the cliff. There was a spirit at the top, so I turned my senses. What I saw caused me to step back. There was this massive creature standing there. It was human-like, but it had this large gray....armor on its back that went up to its head. "Uh.....why do I have to stand guard...?" he moaned. "It's like there won't be any humans coming up here. They basically stopped coming once those weird things came through. Its like none of them could get up here anyway. Their strength is no match for ours." He sighed again and stood his post. I acyually felt sorry for the guy. Whatever her was.

I ran down the path, dodging several blasts of steam that were coming out of the walls and floor. As we moved on, I heard a singing-like noise. At first I thought it was a bug, but it was coming from a stone. It had a hole straight throught the center and made a certain pitch. I started to hum the tone, and the sound grew louder. I am so going to regret this... I howled the tone loudly into the air. I kept "singing" the tone, but then I heard another wolf howl along with me. Eventually, we both stopped and I finally opened my eyes. The area around us changed. It looked completely different, like an enclosed area of everything in Hyrule. I was on a cliff, and the other wolf, the golden wolf from before, stood on the other. "If teachings of old you want to learn, come with sword in hand and find me." He jumped off the cliff and the vision ended.

"Wow that was intesne" I said. "Link might want to do this. He's more of a wolf than me." I continued to run down the path and soon entered a more open area. I now had a greater view of Death Mountain. And boy, I hope to the Goddesses that the Fused Shadow was NOT in there. Lots more steam vents blocked my path, but with Midna's help, we were able to dodge them all. The last two were at the bottom of another cliff. Before I could even think about jumping, the ground beneath me rumbled. I fell over the edge, but fell into water. The water was nice and cool. I saw the two Bugs through my senses, but something else triggered my senses. A falling flaming rock fell where I used to stand. I quickly destroyed the two bugs and gathered the tears. I was instantly teleported, just before a large flaming boulder fell on me. I knew for sure Midna wouldn't help me out of that one.

I instantly stood beside Link and the lake began to glow again. A small orb formed out from the lake, and another creature formed from the light. It resembled the owl, actually it resembled the statue I saw earlier. I noticed that both of us were human once again. And sadly, I noticed that I had a bow with no string or a quiver with no arrows. For everything, I would at least think the Goddesess would give me a few simple items. I spaced out throught the beginning of the lecture, but I remembered that I had to at least try to pay attention. Unfortunantly, I listened in at the wrong time. "The item you seek lies deep with Death Mountain" she said. "Please young heroes, be careful."

The light died down and I faced Link. I had a lot of explaining to do. But, a voice cut me off, "Link? Tolray?" We turned to see Colin at the door. He smiled and ran out. But he was trambled by the other kids. Colin got up but ran after us again. Link and I were happily greeted by our friends. Renado, Barnes, and the girl walked right out. "So you are the two that these children have been talking so much about" he said. "I am Renado, shamin of this village. And this...." Barnes waved his hand happily, "Is my daughter Luda." Barnes dropped his mask and walked off. Luda bowed slightly in response to her father. After everything, I filled Link in with everything.

"So the Fused Shadow is somewhere in the mountain?" he asked.

"Yep, but there are these creatures that block the path" I replied.

Link shrugged and began to climb the railing. Midna popped up beside me, "Do you think he's going to make it?" Link fell down face first into the ground with a thud. "That answers that question" I replied. We looked up at the creature, "Don't come back human! You cannot match out strength!" The creature walked off and out of sight. Me and Midna smiled towards each other as Link got up. "That was entertaining" she said. Link's glare slienced her and she disappeared into my shadow. That's weird, if she hated me why travel into my shadow?

As we walked down, Renado approached us. He seemed surprised. "Oh good, you two are still alive" he said. "No one has ever faced the Gorons and lived. Well, without major injuries." Link straightened his back a little and I could have sworn I heard Midna giggled. "The Gorons were once our friends, but something happened to them. Now they only shun us from even getting close to the mountain."

"Is there any way we can get up there?" I asked.

"The Goron tribe only recognizes strength. To humans, their strength is ten fold. However, there was one person that was able to win over their trust. He goes by the name Bo."

Without another word, Link and I ran off, thanking him in the process. "How are we supposed to get back to Ordon?" asked Link. "Midna can't teleport us and it would take days to walk." A loud horse whine sounded behind us and we both turned. Epona, Link's horse, was galloping through the town with this creature on his back. It was the same creature that attacked us at the spring. He flew off and Epona went wild. We needed to calm him down.

"What!? uh um.... huh?" Link responds by trying to come up with a way for you to not take the next weapon. "Ha ha ha ha ahha h ah ah ah ha haah haha ha ha." a unionized laugh made by You and Bo.

After a bit of chit chat with Bo, you and Link left for Kakariko Village. Upon getting there you remember that the place your about to traverse has a vast amount of fire. "Hey Link, I think it would be better for you to have a shield made of metal." Before any one an say any thing else, the ground starts to shake. "What the hell is going on?" unionized question by the two heroes.
15112111221112111111111.title: A not so happy home coming. Sumo showdown.

151121112211121111111111.content:
Link lead Epona throught the final pass before getting to the village. Renado was beside the path beside Beth. Link stopped short of the two. "What happened?!" he asked. Beth seemed to be in tears, but she looked up at us, "Those monsters took Colin!" Renado nodded in agreement. "They just ran up the path" he explained. "If you run know you might be able to catch them."

Link took no time in commanding Epona and rushing to the scene. As we passed the buildings, I saw Barnes with his mask down, standing still like a statue. He probably saw the fat pig but got scared. I laughed at this, but this moment wasn't a laughing matter. Colin was in danger. It was kinda hard not to fall off of Epona, I never rode a horse before. But, I was able to hang on by hanging onto Link. He looked back, "Remind me to get a saddle for you next time we ride" he said. I ignored his slightly humorous comment and tried my best to hang on. Soo enough, we reached the open field. Standing there on the hill, was the obese Bulbin himself, King Bulbin. He was riding this large boar with a head piece to it. King Bulbin also had a large staff with a flag flowing behind him. The next thing I saw made me mad, and I almost guarentee Link was too. Colin was tied to this pole like some trophy he won. I could actually feel Link's anger rise. King Bulbin chuckled at us but then reached for an object attached to his belt. It was a horn, a long white horn. He blew into it, creating a loud echoing sound that channeled through the open field. As called, several Bulbins came rushing in on pigs of their own. King Bulbin reared back on his boar and rode off. Link took no pause as he chased after him. There was no way that boar of his was faster than a horse, let alone Epona. We would rescue Colin and show that oversized freakshow what we're made of. But, there had to be a challenge. A arrow flew just inches above my head. I turned to see that all of his lackies at least had one archer. Great, another perfect opportunity to use my completely useless bow. Another arrow was shot but it missed us barely. It struck just where Epona's leg used to be.

"Uh Link, we have a situation back here!" I shouted. I got his attention, but he didn't bother to turn around. "We have to get to Colin Tolray" he said.

"You don't think I know that?! All I'm saying is that we are running around like moving targets!" An arrow flew by us, but this one managed to catch a pieve of my clothing. Flames began to spread across my clothing and my skin began to burn. "Oh, and did I forget to mention that the arrows are on FIRE?!" I managed to put the fire out, but more and more Bulbins came after us. I had nothing to defend us with. Or so I thought. As I brushed the burned pieces of cloth, I brushed against my belt and pockets. I felt two things; the Gale Boomarang and my slingshot. A smile stretched across my face. I grabbed the Gale Boomarang, aimed carefully, and threw it. Three Bulbins went down along with their hogs. But there were still many left. All of them had an archer, and all of them had an arrow ready. They all shot at once, but all of them missed. Man, how lousy of a shot were these things? One was quicker on the reload and already cocked an arrow. Now, I was going to have a little fun.

I pulled out my slingshot and aimed right between the Bulbin's eyes. I let go just as I saw him get ready to let go. The seed hit it dead on, and the Bulbin archer collapsed. Just before he fell off, his arrow was released and hit the Bulbin beside him. I continued this for a while, but then we reached King Bulbin. Link drew his sword with his right hand as he held Epona's reigns in his left. Link managed a couple of slashes, but the he decided to go offensize as well. He grabbed what looked like a mixture of a lance and sword and raised it far above his head. Acting quickly, I grabbed Link's shield and got in front of the sword. It hit, but I was ready. He tried it several times, but I blocked it several times. Eventually he ran ahead of us and blew his horn again. I felt like I was getting more of a workout from this than Link was. We reached King Bulbin once again, but at the last second his last lacky shot and arrow. I had Link's shield in hand so on instinct I raised it. The arrow hit, but I soon learned the cost of my mistake. The shield burned up in my hands and now Link was defenseless. King Bulbin was laughing at us now and he prepared an attack. I looked ahead of us and saw that we were coming up on a bridge. King Bulbin swung down his attack, Link scared stiff. Oh this is going to hurt... I jumped in front of Link and was slammed by King Bulbin's attack. I was instantly knocked out cold.

(3rd person)
Tolray was knocked aside from the blow by King Bulbin's massive weapon. Tolray's limp body landed harshly on the ground just as Link galloped past. Link was devestated but King Bulbin was laughing. His laughter caused Link to grasp his sword and deliever more blows to the king. They rode onto the bridge which soon was blocked by fire on both ends. Unknwon to Link, Midna was in Tolray's shadow. She popped up beside him and looked down at his motionless body. Although her entire body appeared to be a shadow, sadness and concern was in her eyes.

(Midna's thoughts)
Oh no! Tolray! Is he...is he....dead...? No! No, don't think about him! Its his fault he burned the shield and it was his fault he was hurt. I don't....I.....I-I-I don....I do! I do care about him! He was willing to risk himself to save me, now he risked his life to save Link! Please, please be okay!

(Tolray's mind)
I saw nothing but darkness. I was surrounded by complete darkness. I wasn't scared, I was actually glad to be here. It had a....homey feeling... Several symbols flew by me again and again. Some looked foreign, but others looked familiar. One was getting small enough and seemed to want to wrap around my right arm. I pushed it away. Besides that, everything seemed right. However, something in the air seemed troubling. I could hear cries of some kind. It sounded like an older woman, it sounded familiar. Distant, but familiar. But then, everything became silent. The silence was broken by a loud and shrill scream that rung my eardrums. I had no idea what was causing it, but it stopped as soon as it started. "What is this place?"

Some light filled the darkness and cast a beam of it straight onto the floor. What was in the light caught my attention. It appeared to be Midna, her back facing me. She seemed to be passed out and in pain. I quickly ran over to her and gently picked her up. "Midna...are you...?" I was cut off as her head turned, revealing her face. It wasn't a face, it was a full on scary helmet. Suddenly a black force launched me away and evil laughter filled the room. Midna's body slowly shifted into that of a robed man, by the sound of the laughter. "You pathetic human" it said, "You trust this being but she will use you as a common sword. Once it gets dull and rusted, she'll throw it away for a new one."

"I don't think so" I replied. "She saved me before I died. If she was like that she would have left me to die."

"Oh....she saved you?" The strange man laughed slightly at first, but then he broke out into a full fledged insane laughter. "The dear Midna saved a lowly human of the light world, but fails to help her people. Watch yourself....she will treat you like trash..."

I had enough of this guy. I charged towards him but heard a voice...."Tolray, please tell me your alright." It sounded...like Midna. Light entered my eyes and I found myself facing the sky. I sat up, expecting Midna. But I saw Malo and Beth. "What...what happened?"
151121112211121111111111.title: The goblin hord that kidnaped the kids.

1511211122111211111111111.content:
I sat up and looked around. I was inside the one house that I first saw them in. I noticed that only Beth and Malo were inside. "Thank goodness you're awake" said Beth. "We thought you would never wake up. After Link saved Colin, we found you collapsed on the ground. We feared the worse, but Renado took care of you." I got up and grabbed my stuff. The kids seemed to know what we were planning on doing next, so they left for their own thing. I watched as Link walked back with a relieved smile. He joined us and we headed towards Death Mountain. I noticed on his back was a metal shield.

"I see you took my advice and got a new shield" I said.

"Yeah, I did" he replied. "But this time, you paid for it."

"Wait...WHAT?!"

"You stole out of my wallet for those lanterns, so I grabbed some of your Rupees out from your wallet. Oh, and by the way, Midna was worried about you."

I usually would be mad, but hearing that kind of cooled me down. The thing that the creep in my dream mentioned about her. What about her people? What....exactly is Midna? Is she of some importance. My thought were stopped when I walked into the cliff. Link started to climb up the grate once again, rechallenging the Goron. Midna popped up beside me. I noticed that she seemed to try and ignore me. Was it something I tried against the Bulbins? She looked up, "I don't think Link will win this time." As on cue, Link fell off the cliff once again. I chuckled, "That's Goron: 2, Link: 0" Link got up and brushed himself off. He looked around but glared at Midna. She pointed down, where his Iron Boots were. Link put them on and started to climb up the grate. I never thought Link could climb while wearing those heavy boots. But, he made it to the top. I heard rumbling at the top, and the Goron fell over the edge instead. He kept on rolling down the path to Kakariko Village. I climbed my way up, and saw another Goron fall over. As soon as I reached the top, two more Gorons fell over the edge. Link grabbed my hand and pulled me up.

Since I visited here when it was covered in Twilight, I lead the way. We passed through the steam vents with ease since I knew the path. We passed that howling stone again, but this time I couldn't here anything coming from it. Either it was only my shadow beast form or there was no longer anything inside it. The ground rumbled some more, but it was nothing major. Soon enough, we reached the clearing. This time, we could see the amount of Gorons guarding the Mountain. I caught a pair at the top with my eyes, one was on the other's back and he was launched up the edge. The Goron then rolled into the cave up top. "Hey Link" I said while walking forward, "I think i know how to..." The ground shook greatly, causing Link to stumble a little. A large shadow loomed over me, and I looked up. Before I noticed it, I slipped and a giant rock fell where I used to be. I could still feel the heat coming off of it. Man, good thing I slipped.

(Midna's thought's)
D-Did....did he notice...? No....good....he didn't know it was me. Why am I so worried over him? And why did I confess over him when no one was around? Is he...is he really that....special...to me...? No, he can't be. Although I can't be so sure anymore....I keep saying no but I always end up helping him....what's wrong with me...?

(Back to Tolray)
After a exhausting climb up, we made it to the mine entrance. Along the way we noticed that there was this spring near the bottom. All of the Gorons at the bottom were friendly, unlike the ones we've met up the mountain. Trust me, you don't know how many times I was punched by those oversized boulders. There was even a shop down there. They sold arrows, but nothing to fix my bow. I guess I had to stick with my hunting knife and Gale Boomerang. We walked through the entrance, but we both regretted it. Six Gorons were beginning to charge at us. They began to roll, and we cowarded. "STOP!" shouted a voice. We looked behind two Gorons, and noticed a smaller one. This one looked like he had hair growing out of the sides of his head, but was still bald. "Must we gang up on these humans all at once little brothers?" he asked. Link stepped up as well as I. "I'm impressed humans, I never would have guessed you made it this far" he said. "My name is Cor Goron. I am the...current leader of the Gorons. Ever since out Patriarch was transformed and sealed him away, I took charge. But soon afterward the mountain has began to erupt violently. Seeing you here means you want to go into the mines. Of course humans are not allowed to enter." Link approached him even closer, and Cor Goron smiled. "Very well, let us see what strength you have."

The sumo match was inevitable, Link won. This time he remembered the Iron Boots. The elder was easily beaten, but they never seemed to notice the boots. No wonder Bo won their friendship, they were too dumb to realize that those boots were the real source. Of course, we were allowed access. But, they would only truly accept our friendship if we help their Patriarch. I didn't need Midna, I knew that the Fused Shadow was obviously to blame.

I'll tell you what, they don't call it Death Mountain for nothing. It was unbearably hot inside! Lava was flowing like rivers inside this oven! Link seemed content, but I couldn't stand it. I never was good with heat. But, if he can go through with it, so could I. Some of the equipment around the mine required Goron weight. Link took care of that with those Iron Boots. Thankfully Midna's abilities allowed us to quickly change them off and on so we wouldn't be held back with putting them on. Another thing to add, I am useless in this place! Sure I could defeat a few of those Fire Slugs hanging from the ceiling, but those giant lizard things were tough! They could only be injured by hitting their tail. And since I had no real way of injuring them, guess who had to distract them. No other explanation needed.

The weirder part about the mine was that there was this area that you could see the sky. And it looked like Gorons couldn't go throught there, so how did they get here? As we walked through, a flaming arrow flew by my head and hit the rock beside me. The only things with flaming arrows were the Bulbins. Link and I ducked behind a large crate big enough for both of us. "Still think their angry about injuring their leader?" asked Link. I turned the corner but was greeted by a barrage of flaming arrows. "Does that answer your question?" I threw the Gale Boomerang to distract them as we ran past them. We entered the other room and stopped. I really wished I had a bow in working order. Link continued on and I followed. Eventually, we entered this large room. There was this large rock in the center and it was attached to the ceiling. Link stepped on and the rock suddenly fell. I ran towards the edge but stopped short. The giant rock was now floating in lava. A jump from here could end up making me fall into the lava. But Link had more trouble; he wasn't the only one on the rock. There was the big Goron covered in armor across from him. And when I say big, I mean he is MASSIVE! Link drew his sword at the ready, but his footing began to slip. The Goron guard begn walking closer to him. The rock itself was tilting down where the Goron was. The rock had this shiny surface which was underneath them both. The guard walked closer and closer, causing the rock to tilt further and further. If this kept up Link would eventually fall into the lava. Weird, the Goron didn't have any problems with falling. That's it.

"Link your Iron Boots!" I shouted. Link understood and put them on. Now, he was able to stand up. The Goron switched tactics and rolled towards him. I smiled, and I knew Link was smiling. He grabbed the Goron and threw him over the edge. The Goron screamed in pain but landed back on the rock. The battle got boring when it continued the same way. But finally, the Goron guard stood down. The lave rose and I was able to step across without falling or sliping off. The Goron guard said something to us, but I didn't really pay attention. He said something about three elders and pieces of a key. Then, he said something about the hero's lost weapon. Link thanked him and we left to the back room. Inside was a pillar of rocks with rock steps. At the top of the pillar was a chest. Together, Link and I opened it. Inside, was a bow! I grabbed it and pulled back on the string. Tightly wound and in perfect condition. But, there was something else inside the chest. It was a bow string. I handed the Hero's Bow to Link.

"Are you sure?" he asked.

"Their is a bow string in the chest. You can have this one and I can just use the string to fix mine."

Link accepted it and I began to fix my bow. Just because I had a bow with a string already attached doesn't mean I can't fix a bow of my own. With one final tweak, I now have a actual bow. Link might need a little training but I could teach him. "Let's go save the Patriarch" said Link. "And get the Fused Shadow" I said.
1511211122111211111111111.title: Going through the Mountain/FINALLY!

choices: Wake up back at that hut
15112111221112111111111111.content:
(to note, I may actually speed this chapter up a bit.)

To get back to the main mines, we needed to go back. And to go back, we would need to cross the Bulbins again. But, this time I was ready. I had a quiver full of arrows and a newly strung bow. Link would deflect the arrows and I would shoot mine. The Bulbins were powerful in numbers, that was for sure. But alone, they were as much of a threat as Midna. They are only annoying, not violent. However, the Bulbins were the easiest of the threats.

In one of these rooms were these strange ancient machines that revolved their “heads.” They were called Beamos, and they shot out a laser from their “eye” whenever you approached them too close. And distracting it and trying to destroy it with a sword didn’t work. You can ask Link to see how that turned out. No, the only weakness to those things is by shooting an arrow into the red eye. Once it hit, it deactivates permanently. Those things were so annoying. But those Beamos were not as annoying as some of the rooms in the mine. There was these few areas with magnetic stone and only Link could cross it since he had the Iron Boots. Me, I just had to sit and wait. I’m sure Midna was with me, but I guess she didn’t really want to talk. I still couldn’t get her out of my mind. That strange…man said some pretty disturbing things. Minda…she was hiding something. I wouldn’t let that get between the trust I have for her, but still she was hiding something. But, I had to admit, everyone has secrets. So I might as well respect hers.

Getting the three pieces of the keys was relatively easy. The Gororn elders were not exactly what I realized. I thought that we would have to challenge them or something, but the three were very small and seemed kind of weak. I didn’t even know how they could possibly get that far into the mines. But, nevertheless, we got all three pieces. They fit perfectly into a single rounded key. The final room had a very large door with the keyhole in the exact shape of the key.

“Got everything we need?” asked Link.

“My quiver is full of arrows, got the Gale Boomerang ready in case we need it, I’m ready” I replied. “Still have your shield?”

Link raised it up, making it presentable. “You know, they never told us how the Patriarch was changed.”

“Well, based on the facts that Death Mountain keeps erupting, and the increased lava flow, my guess is that the Patriarch must have mutated to where he is now living heat.”

“Tolray, you’re my friend, but sometimes you can be such a nerd.”

I laughed sarcastically and inserted the key inside the hole. The lock let loose a might creak as the tumbler unlocked. The lock fell to the ground with a thump, and the door opened. Link and I faced each other, nodded, and ran inside. We entered the room, and immediately I strung by bow. It was very dark in this room, not a single source of light to be found. However, I heard two things. One was a deep and loud breathing. The next thing I heard was the door behind us shutting and locking quickly. The breathing became stuttered, meaning whatever was in here was beginning to wake up. Link gasped, obviously in slight fear. I turned ahead and saw what he saw. Whatever it was, it was big, muscular, black, and sure as hell scary. Its arms and legs were chained to the ground. The only distinct feature I could see was this weird helmet. A gemstone in the center of the helmet began to glow a bright yellow. As the gem was glowing, two eyes began to appear as well. He growled at first, but then he roared at us, trying to get closer. But the chains were restraining him. He seemed to notice this, pulling at the chains slightly. I laughed at this, meaning he would never be able to hit us. Suddenly, his black body burst into flames. Link put his shield up and I ducked behind it with him. One by one, the four sets of chains that held him down were now broke. He roared at us, his breath and heat clearly a problem.

“Midna…mind telling us what this guy is?” I asked.

“He is the Twilit Igniter, Fyrus” she replied.

Fyrus began to charge at us, but we separated. However he charged after me. Luckily I cocked my bow when I had the chance. I shot an arrow and tried to aim it at his body. But the flames burned the arrow quickly. This guy wasn’t going to be easy to hit. I noticed that his head was always at an angle towards me when he was charging. The gemstone on his helmet had a black slit in it…almost like an eye…

An idea struck me, whether it was dumb or not. I cocked another arrow and shot it at the gemstone. Energy blasted out from the gem and Fyrus roared. He began to run around the small room while holding his “eye.” The chains drug behind him, some scrapped up the dirt of the floor. I noticed that the floor was blue and shiny, like those rocks. Link thought of the same thing as I saw him put on the Iron Boots and grab a chain. With a large yank, Fyrus crashed into one of the pillars and collapsed. The flames surrounding his body were gone. I ran up near his head and saw that he was weak at the moment.

“Link! Hit the gemstone on his forehead! That’s his weak spot!” I shouted.

Link had trouble getting his boots off. I knew why, Midna wasn’t helping him. “Midna help him!” I shouted. Her shadow popped up beside mine, “You two need to learn to not constantly use me. After all, you’re my slaves.”

“Yeah, well your not royalty, but you sure are acting like a royal b-”

I was suddenly grabbed by Fyrus. I could tell it was him, nothing else in the room was that big. I tried to fight his grip, but his flames reignited again. The pain was unbearable! My entire chest was burning like it was being dipped in lava! He threw me into a wall hard. My back nearly shattered on impact. “Uh…the pain…”

(Midna’s thoughts)
Oh no! Tolray! What have I done?! If I would have listened to him, he wouldn’t be hurt! Oh no! Fyrus is going to kill him!

(Back to Tolray)
The pain was too great, but I could see what was coming. Fyrus was nearly inches from my face. He opened his mouth and let loose a very loud roar. I could feel the heat, and smell his breath. But this was no time to make jokes. I tried to reach for my bow, but my arm was in too much pain. Suddenly, something shot from behind me and stuck the gemstone. Fyrus was too surprised and in pain that he fell backwards. Link was back there with his sword at the ready. I couldn’t see what was happening, everything was blurry. But, I could hear Link using the final blow and Fyrus roaring in pain. The roaring stopped, and then the room began to light up. An explosion of a black mass occurred and then everything seemed to be calm. A blob of green approached me next. “Hey man, you don’t look so good.” That was all I heard before I passed out.
15112111221112111111111111.title: A Burning Boss Battle

151121112211121111111111111.content:
As Tolray starts to reawaken, his vision is very blurted but he can hear clearly. "We have to hurry. The only thing that can heal him right now is the hot spring." Said a blob of brownish orange. The rest of the time was felt like he was being carried around. "There we go. He should be fine in about two or three hours." said the same blob. "Thank you." Said a green blob, obviously Link. Tolrays vision went black as he fell asleep.

(In Tolrays mind.)
"What the hell happened? Where am I? How did I get this burn..... Oh right, Fyrus." Appears in a dark void, then visions of an odd looking woman go by. "Who is this?" Visions of the woman continue to go by. She is now seen with a man with a cloak, a short sword, and a bit of a beard. "Who are these people?" The visions of the people stop playing and Tolray finds him self in an odd looking room. A voice speaks to him. ""These images you saw will be seen again. Only when the secret is to be reveled."" "Who are you what secret?" ""In time..... In time you will know it all." Tolrays visions then stop and all he sees is an endless black void.

(Back to the real world)
Little did Tolray know, but he was being watched over by Midna. "This is my fault. Why didn't I listen to him." Midna places her hand on Tolray's chest. Then she feels a warmth in her heart she never felt before. "Oh Tolray. I don't know what I feel when I'm around you nor do I know how to express it. I am sorry if I caused you any harm." Midna lies down next to Tolray and falls asleep.

Tolray then starts to wake up as Midna notices it, she disappears into his shadow. "What the hell is this?" said Tolray "You were injured in your fight against Fyrus." said an unknown voice. Tolray turns around and sees...........
151121112211121111111111111.title: A short chapter..... But it's better than nothing.

1511211122111211111111111111.content:
I saw green once I turned around. It was Link, smiling down at me. I tried to get up, but there was too much pain. Now that I was aware, I looked at my surroundings. I was in the Goron Hot Springs. I was capable of looking down, seeing that my clothes were now burned and a large burn the shape of a hand was on my chest.

“That will take a while to heal” I said.

“But it looks cool” said Link.

“At least you don’t have all of this pain. Did we at least get the Fused Shadow?”

Link nodded as he held his hand up. The Fused Shadow looked like a piece of ancient armor. A hand formed out of Link’s shadow and grabbed it. The Fused Shadow disappeared along with the hand. Midna popped up and glared at me. “Way to go Tolray, without you Link had to fight Fyrus all by himself. You should really try to focus on what I ask of you instead of other’s well being."

(Minda’s thoughts)
Ouch…that hurt. But I can’t let him get even the slightest hint that I care for him. No matter how much it hurts.

(Real world)
Midna seemed like she did not want to say that. Who am I kidding? Of course she meant that, she cares for no one but herself and what she wants. The pain was going away faster than I anticipated. I was now capable of sitting up. Link kneeled beside me, “There is also someone here that wants to apologize.” He turned as a large shadow began to loom over me. In front of me stood the biggest Goron I have ever seen.

“I would like to thank you for freeing me” he said in the deepest voice I have ever heard. “My name is Darbus, I am the Patriarch of the Gorons. I would espically like to apologize to you young human, for your efforts helped your friend to defeat me without causing any fatalities. But you suffer from the major burn that I delivered while I was a monster. I hope you could forgive my foolishness.”

I was surprised that a large and muscular Goron like him was actually asking for forgiveness. “It is fine Brother Darbus” I said, trying to sound like a Goron, “You were unable to control your actions. Your are forgiven.”

(short chapter, sorry)
1511211122111211111111111111.title: Link.

choices: Minda forces him to go. Same old Midna
Midna let's Link stay. Change of heart...?
15112111221112111111111111111.content:
The Goron Springs work wonders. The pain in my chest vanished completely, but it took a couple of hours. I honestly did not mind. Some of the Goron kids took interest in what I've done. I'm usually not the bragging type, but it felt good to talk about the battle. If I ever had a kid, I would tell them the story of this adventure. I could tell it was far from over.

Once we were mobile, Link and I entered the village. Of course, I had a repeat of what happened at the springs. While I was telling the story, Renado treated my burn. He said it shouldn't become a problem for me, but it could be permanent. I actually did not mind at all. Before we left, we restocked on supplies. We even got something new. Barnes, the guy that always wears that metal mask, makes bombs. He's actually useful for something.

Once we were prepared, we climbed onto Epona and rode off. The vast field seemed more peaceful without those Bulbins. I'm surprised that the bridge stayed in one peace too. However I ate my own words when we finished crossing. A red portal formed above the bridge. With a blast of black energy, a large chunk of the bridge was destroyed. Not only that, but three Shadow Beasts now loomed around. I wonder why Midna couldn't stay in daylight.

"Should we turn back?" Link asked while he tugged on the reigns. Epona seemed spooked, not likely able to move back.

"No, I have an idea."

I grabbed the bomb bag filled with our new bombs and began to tinker them with my arrows. Link looked over my shoulder, but he was a little late. I aimed the bow to where the creatures were. With a quick release, my arrow soared into the sky with a following trail of smoke. The arrow landed in the middle of the monsters with a large explosion. A blue portal formed from the bits of the creatures. Link looked both shocked and impressed, "What did you do?!"

"I combined my arrows with the bombs to make, what I call bomb arrows. Tis a good new weapon... and the best part is that I can switch these out with regular arrows, and you will still be able to throw the bombs."

Link smiled and signaled Epona to move forward. But she wouldn't move closer. Link and I both looked up, the curtain of Twilight was upon us. "Do you think Epona will change with us?"

Link shook his head sadly. We both climbed off of Epona. I managed to approach the curtain, but Link did not. He stayed with Epona for a while, petting her mane gently. The scene was sweet, but there was someone who always ruins it. Midna popped up beside me, "Hurry up! We need to keep going!"

That was it. She could taunt me until I was in deep pain, maybe even about my feelings, but she will not taunt Link. I turned to face her, "That's enough! You don't understand, and you will never understand! Epona has been with Link since they were young! Why are you so mean to us?! We are helping you willingly! Why can't you be like everyone and have a heart?!"

Midna stood somewhat shocked. It felt bad, but it was true. Midna shakingly lowered her head, "I will leave you alone..." With that, she disappeared into my shadow. Link looked at me with a hint of disappointment in his stare. I would be too, it almost seemed like Midna was about to cry.

(Midna)
Tears were beginning to form in my eyes. "Why...Why did he say that...?" I asked myself. "Do I really seem that cruel to them...?" My voice was being called, I needed to calm myself. I dried the tears and reformed.

(Tolray)
Midna reappeared from my shadow. "Let me guess, you two need my help [i]again[/i]." I was sort of relieved that she wasn't effected. But I sort of wished that she would ease up a little. Midna passed over into the curtain, and the process repeated itself.

Midna went on my back still, but something was off. She didn't make a comment saying the Twilight was better than the light, she didn't make some remark to make us go faster, she didn't do any of the regular stuff. She was...quiet. Link and I were both surprised, but we kept running. I had no idea where we were, well at least until we saw something. It was a castle, Hyrule Castle. We basically returned from where we once were. Midna was utterly shocked, but never spoke a word. I was getting worried now.

Link suddenly stopped as we ran. I turned around to see him sniffing a bag. The bag looked familiar, but it was a little too dark to see. Link, however, must have caught the scent. His head shot up, his ears perked, and his eyes shot open. "...Illia..."

I immediately knew what he felt. Link loved Illia, and some say she does back. Like a bolt of lightning, Link shot off with great speed. I had trouble catching up, and Midna was having a hard time staying on. It seemed like Illia's scent was trailing towards the castle. However Link's timing was almost perfect, as he ran heartless into the energy walls of those traps. Luckily I didn't need to do much but use an energy field. Link quickly ran inside with me following.

I was amazed. Sure I knew Hyrule Castle was a nice sight to see, but I saw the many souls wander through the town. The first thing Midna spoke surprised me, "It's sad to see creatures live like this..,"

We weren't that weak to be called creatures, but what she said was true. All of the people in Castle Town were not aware of the curtain of Twilight. It was sad.

We followed Link to what looked like a bar. I used my senses so I could see what he saw. Sitting right there, was Illia. Sitting next to her seemed to be a Zora child. A Zora was a humanoid fish-like creature that is seen around vast amounts of water. But this one seemed very sick. Link was staring directly at Illia sitting in front of her. Midna looked down at me, "I overheard a few guards over there. They said something about the lake. We should listen in..."

"I will... But I don't think Link will. Should we leave him here...?"

151121112211121111111111111112.content:
"N-No...he's been through enough already" Midna said nervously, "We can tell him later..." I started to turn, but she tugged on my ear, "Think. Nothing. Of it."

I rolled my eyes and walked towards the table. The guards around it marked a bridge on the map. "Alright" the head solider started, "The water for the lake seems to have disappeared. People cannot go to the Goddess shrine until then. We cross this bridge here to investigate the problem."

I left after that to find Link. He seemed more determined to stop the Twilight from taking over this area. I briefly explained the situation as we left the tavern. We had to fight a few enemies on the way over but we made it to the bridge. A weird smell passed over my nose but I ignored it as we walked over. However the smell kept coming back. "Hey" Midna said, "Do you smell something?" Link and I sniffed the ground. It smelled like...lantern oil! Link began to growl, catching our attention. A Twilit Bulbin was on the other side. In his hands was a bow, cocked and loaded with a flaming arrow. He shot it to the the other side. A trail of flames started behind us. Then, he shot another arrow in the front. So now, there were two trails of flames coming at us from both ends.

"What do we do now?!" shouted Link.

Acting on instinct, I pushed Link towards the edge. The flames were coming on faster than I expected. I grabbed Midna, gently, and placed her on his back. "What are you doing?" she shouted.

"Saving you." I pushed them over the edge, the lake should have broken their fall. I prepared to jump, but the flames caught up. I howled in pain as the flames burned my back legs and tail. In a last ditch effort, I jumped. But the pain was so great that I faded out.

choices: Go on to the frozen area
1511211122111211111111111111121.content:
My vision was blurry, my lower body coursing with pain. My eyes eventually adjusted to the faded light from the Twilight clouds. One thing was that I was underwater. The second, I was in my aquatic form. Thirdly, I was on the sandy floor. I tried to move but it hurt. I managed to swim to the surface before I stopped. "Tolray!" I managed to turn to see Link swimming out with Midna on his back. He gently grabbed me by his mouth, swam back to shore, and gently let me down. "Tolray...are you okay?" he asked me.

I nodded, "I just feel really weak..."

"Can you change forms?" asked Midna. I could have sworn I saw a bit of concern on her face, but I think that was just my eyes playing tricks. But anyway I was going to try anyway.

I focused on my wolf form, but I was greet with pain instead of the usual warm feeling. I screamed a bit but it did not last long. I took a look at myself, I managed to change into a bat but nothing else. "I...this is all I can do."

Strangely I felt myself being lifted. Even more to my surprise was that it was Midna doing it. She carefully placed me onto Link's back. Both Link and I looked at each other strangely but we ignored it as he walked off. "What happened to all of the water?" Midna asked.

"The guards..." I managed, "Said there was...something wrong...near the top of the spring. Something about...Zoras..."

"Well we should go there."

"Uh Midna, how can we get out?" Link spoke.

That caused me to look around. I've heard of this lake, but even if the water level was at it's normal height we couldn't get out. We could try to warp out, but we would have to cross that flaming bridge. We were in a hole, literally. My eyes caught a small spirit to what looked like a building. "Hey Link, try there."

Their attention was caught onto the small blue flame. I was still to weak to understand the spirit; once again I was too weak. Despite not being able to see, my ears detected something else. It was a Bulbin, a Twilit Bulbin. Link and Midna soon joined me. Link headed to the monster. As we traveled, I could have sworn I saw Midna looking at me. But I ignored it.

(Midna's thoughts)
This human, Tolray...he's different. He saved his friend and me, and hurt himself. Why would he sacrifice so much to those around him? Does he even care for himself?

(Reality)
The monster encounter was different than most. Instead of it attacking us, it grabbed a hawk reed and blew into it. It was strange, I have never seen a monster do that. But my confidence drained with the answer, and the answer was a loud unnatural shrill.

Flying down was a large, monstrous bird. At least I thought it was; it's face looked more like a flower than anything. But that wasn't the worst part. The monster that called it, was now riding on that thing's back!

It dove at us but luckily Link dodged it. I no longer had the pain but I did not think I could fly. "Sorry Link, looks like you're going to fight this one on your own."

"Your fine, Link has this." We were once again surprised by Midna's words. Did I say something that caused all of this?

As were stood in shock, that gave the monstrous bird an opening. Link was swiftly knocked to the side. He let out a large grunt when he landed. That tore it; pain or no pain, I was NOT going to sit there and watch my friend get hurt. I took to the air despite the pain. I swarmed around the monster controlling it, hitting it with my wings. I wish I had a mouth.

Before I could stop I was swatted away. I fell to the ground in terrible pain, new and old. I felt like I was finished. However, I heard the monster bird screech; not in anger, but in pain. I looked to see Link attacking the beast. The rider was knocked off, soon replaced with another rider.

The bird shook heavily and roared as it tried to shake Midna off. "Stop!" she spoke, "I'm your master now!" The creature stopped, allowing the sudden change. Link and I exchanged looks before staring in awe. "Hey" she spoke, "Do you think that we could use this to get up to the top?" she asked. We both nodded but wasn't sure how we were going to get there. Midna suddenly grabbed Link and took off. I was suddenly teleported right in front of her. She looked down at me and smiled. I just hung on as we flew up.

The trip up was not as easy as what we thought. Several Twilit Bulbins were perched in the rocky tunnel, armed with bomb arrows. Thankfully Midna had better control of that bird than that monster. She evaded the falling stalactites and crumbling columns.

The bird dropped us off on a little hill beside a small shack. Link had a rougher drop off but we all made if safely. I was feeling better, but I did not think I could change to a wolf or fly. I shifted into a snake so I was at least mobile. Midna and I climbed onto Link's back.

"Why is it...cold?" Link asked.

I could feel it too. And I was sure Midna was feeling it as well. But she glared at me a bit; I guess she was never taught that huddling together helps. I instead coiled around Link, providing a bit of warmth. "Hey look..."

The way I gestured was an icy cavern. I was sure that that was where Zoras were once. But we turned to Midna to decide.
1511211122111211111111111111121.title: Midna Changes

151121112211121112.content:
Link and I walked into the spring. Whatever was calling us sounded very serene. It almost sounded graceful. But when we entered the center, red structures fell from the sky; creating a ring around us. Red energy flowed between them, trapping us inside. "Be warned...a creature of darkness...it approaches..."

Now she tells us...

A red portal formed above us. One single thing dropped out before it disappeared. A black creature with markings, like me, landed on the ground with a loud thump. Most creatures from this world cannot survive a fall like that. But then again, that wasn't a creature from this world. It stood up on fours, so we could get a good look at it. It's entire head looked like some weird shield. The back of it's head had hair-like tendrils. The rest seemed human...more or less. But, the real problem was it's size. Most of the enemies we faced before were my size. This thing was at least a head taller than a human. I changed into a bat and flew higher, knowing I couldn't do anything. Link, on the other hand, growled directly at the beast. He leapt and bit the monster's shoulder. It screamed in pain but quickly ripped Link off. Before I could check on him, the shadow beast grabbed me. It squeezed me within it's hand, attempting to crush me. I don't know what it was, but something was flowing up my throat. It rushed to my mouth, straining to come out. I wasn't sure what it was, but I opened my mouth anyway. A loud screech came out and hit the Shadow Beast dead on. It caused it to throw me away and cover what probably could be ears. I flapped before hitting the ground, saving myself. I smiled on the inside and screeched loudly. The beast kept his position; hands over ears and not paying attention. I only stopped when I saw Link rush in. With one final pounce, Link bit the beast's neck. It went down with a scream of pain. It burst, but then all of the particles flew towards the sky. A blue portal formed, but nothing came out. It just stayed there. I turned to Link and I saw him drinking the lake.

"That thing tasted horrible!" he said.
151121112211121112.title: Shadow Beast Encounter

1511211122111211122.content:
The spring slowly started to glow. A round orb of light suddenly appeared out from the surface. Then, a beast made of light slowly started to form. It resembled one of those sheep we have back at the ranch. Link's been rammed by one of those so many times I'm surprised that he still offers to herd them. But anyway, Link's and my attention was focused on this beast of light.

"My name is Ordana..." it said with a calm voice. "I am one of the four goddesses that watch over Hyrule. You two are well aware that the power of Twilight has drawn across this land like a large shroud. Sacred blue-eyed beast, you are the lost hero that is meant to save both worlds; the one of light and the one of darkness."

"Wait, why is Link supposed to save the world of darkness?" I asked. "And how do I fit into all of this?"

"Young heroes, you were transformed into these creatures due to the power of the Twilight Realm. The power of the goddesses protected you Link, from turning into a lost spirit. Dear companion to the hero, your prevention from being transformed into a spirit are unknown to me."

"Please Ordana" asked Link, "Will we ever return to our normal forms?"

"As of now you two are under the effect of the massive curtain of Twilight. Nothing here can return you to normal. However, there may be another way. Go within the curtain and find the next goddess at the spring. She might be able to help you there. But be warned, the woods you once knew have been transformed." Ordana slowly began to fade, "Go back were you were first transformed, then all will be revealed."

The spring returned to normal. Link and I were stunned. Midna popped up in front of us both, "Well aren't you special..." she said. "Too bad only one of you is special..." I tried to give her a dirty look but it's hard when you have no mouth and only eyes. "Anyway, I told you were supposed to go to the curtain. When we're there I'll pull you in. Come on get to it!" Midna disappeared into Link's shadow and we were off. We could see the curtain, it was slightly closer. Before we approached it, Link stopped. He turned up to me, "You might want to hold onto me. I don't think Midna can grab us both." I nodded and shifted into my snake form. I curled lightly around Link's neck as he ran in closer. When we were close enough, Midna appeared once more.

"Aww...aren't we a little in a hurry for hugs?" she said mockingly.

"I don't my friend to be left behind" said Link. "Even if I'm the sacred beast, I don't want Tolray to wait."

I raised my head and some of my body up, "But there's a little more room if you want one as well."

Midna gave me a glare when both Link and I chuckled. "Are you two ready or not?!" We nodded our heads and Midna passed through the curtain. A large orange hand busted through the barrier and grabbed us. Quite harshly might I add. Once we were through I uncoiled from Link's neck and slithered forward a bit more. I turned and laughed. Midna was on Link's back as usual, but she had that shield and sword. Only, she was wearing the shield on her face. "So these are the weapons you humans use to smite creatures in your world?" She unsheathed the sword and swung it a few times. Every time barely touched Link's head. She threw the shield down onto Link's head and threw the sword down. It barely got me. "I have no use for these but I'll hang onto them for you." With a snap of her fingers, the sword and shield changed into black energy that was sucked into that mask on her head. Great, so we not only did those errands for nothing but we also have a new unlimited storage space.

We traveled to the next spring but we ran into three more of those creatures. Midna taught Link this energy thing that allowed him to attack multiple enemies in a area. Once we arrived at the spring, we met the goddess. However, she wasn't in her full glory. Only a swirling black cloud of light was there.

"Sacred beast..." she said weakly. "You must collect my scattered light." A shimmering ball of light appeared beside Link and a small plant appeared. "Across these woods are bugs invisible to those of sight. These bugs of evil carry my shattered light. Collect the Tears of Light and place them within the vessel."

Link made his way over and I tried to. "Companion...this is a task for one...you must stay." I nodded and slithered back to a more comfortable position. I found a whole new respect for snakes now. I just realized something, Ordana never said why I was protected. "Excuse me goddess..." I said, "But why am I a feature of Twilight when I should be a spirit?"

1511211122111211122.title: A New Look

15112111221112111222.content:
Chapter Saver

"The power inside you seems to be similar to the one that hides within Link's shadow" the goddess replied.

Midna...does she mean Midna? Well, she's the only one "within" Link's shadow. But, why or how do I have a connection with her? I mean, I was born here and she was born...well technically here but in the Twilight.

It took slightly shorter than I expected for Link and Midna to get back. The Vessel looked more curved than before and it was glowing. The Vessel of Light slowly floated off of Link and landed into the spring. Light finally appeared over the land. Midna was now more in her shadowy form and floated in front of us. "I don't really get the big deal is with the light anyway" she said. "The darkness of Twilight was just fine." She then laughed and flew back into Link's shadow. A glowing orb rose out from the lake as it began to glow. A creature began to form from the surrounding light. I had no idea what the creature was, but whatever it was called it had a really long tail. It completely circled it and ended above it's head.

"I am one of the four spirits that protect these lands" it said. "I am known as Faron. Both of you were transformed by the power of the Twilight. Most who enter the black world of shadow never return to their original forms. However, each of you have  a power within you, that has been protecting you. O brave hero, look upon your new form."

I turned to see Link, but never expected to see him Human. What else was different was his outfit. He was wearing a green tunic along with matching shorts, boots, and a hat. "That tunic once belonged to the legendary hero that once saved this land" continued Faron. "However, your friend wasn't as fortunate."

I noticed that Faron was now talking about me. I looked down at my hands, nothing seemed wrong. But, on my right arm, was this marking. It looked like something from those creatures's faces but had several branching arms out. I regretted it, I looked at my reflection in the water. I was wearing a brown shirt with similar colored pants. I had this blue hood piece on that currently covered my head and part of my face. I just wish it covered up more. My left eye wasn't human. It was completely black with a demonic red eye. If that wasn't enough, black markings crawled down my face from my eye. I looked up at Link, who flinched back after he saw me.

"I'm afraid you still have a hold on your Shadow Beast form" said Faron. "I tried my best to return you to human. Now, a great evil sleeps within the temple in these woods. Link, chosen hero of the gods, please extinguish this evil before it unleashed into the world." With that, Faron disappeared and the spring returned to it's former self.
